content.body: If we were to guess which standard functions do developers most commonly use explicitly, among all JavaScript code, then what would those functions be? `console.log`? `Array.prototype.push`? `Function.prototype.call`? `Array.from`?
content.formatted_body: If we were to guess which standard functions do developers most commonly use explicitly, among all JavaScript code, then what would those functions be? console.log? Array.prototype.push? Function.prototype.call? Array.from?

content.body:
Indeed, when I count occurrences in Gzemnid’s dataset of top-1000 downloaded NPM packages in 2019-09, then I get the following results:

```bash
> ls
search.topcode.sh
slim.topcode.1000.txt.lz4
> ./search.topcode.sh '\b.map\b' | awk 'END { print NR }'
1016503
> ./search.topcode.sh '\.call\b' | awk 'END { print NR }'
500084
> ./search.topcode.sh '\bconsole.log\b' | awk 'END { print NR }'
271915
> ./search.topcode.sh '\.apply\b' | awk 'END { print NR }'
225315
> ./search.topcode.sh '\.bind\b' | awk 'END { print NR }'
170248
> ./search.topcode.sh '\.set\b' | awk 'END { print NR }'
168872
> ./search.topcode.sh '\.push\b' | awk 'END { print NR }'
70116
```

Indeed, when I count occurrences in Gzemnid’s dataset of top-1000 downloaded NPM packages in 2019-09, then I get the following results:

> ls
search.topcode.sh
slim.topcode.1000.txt.lz4
> ./search.topcode.sh '\b.map\b' | awk 'END { print NR }'

> ./search.topcode.sh '\.call\b' | awk 'END { print NR }'

271915
> ./search.topcode.sh '\.apply\b' | awk 'END { print NR }'

70116

content.body: Obviously though these are only rough surrogates for the actual total JavaScript codebase of humankind.
* Obviously though these are only rough surrogates for the actual total JavaScript codebase of humankind.

content.body: I don't trust minimized/transpiled code as much tho. It's no exactly what people write.
